comments.body: These types of spears usually weren't thrown, they were mostly used for thrusting and keeping distance between you and your enemy. A lance could be a term for the Minecraft spears, because spears weren't very heavy and lances were used for jousting, but considering the way lances typically looked they'd have to change the texture as well.

Except this isn't even a lance, it'd look drastically different.

What we have now is a Spear, historically; spears has been used on horseback especially on actual wars just like the way it is portrayed in Minecraft.

If you're going with a realistic and historical angle, guess what? Lances can't be used at all on foot, while you can with Minecraft's Spear, because it IS a spear.
Minecraft's spear is not only for jousting, so we can't name that a lance.

This topic is very controversial. while i do agree that Lance would be a lot more appropiate, because even when spears were used on horseback, they were used for stabbing, not jousting, lances were also way too heavy to stab on foot. I'd suggest making 2 seperate weapons, a spear and a lance, so that this actually works well.
I agree, it feels weird, and I'd prefer if "spears", if added, behaved more like how tridents do.
Yes, this makes a lot more sense, especially considering that you can "joust" with a lance, not a spear
Was about to post this exact suggestion. Spear suggests throwability, Lance does not
We have tridents for that already

Especially with how this weapon is
-notably heavy
-intended to be charged into enemies
-is much weaker when held still
-primarily shown to be used on horseback

Functionally, it's a lance
maybe if it loses a lot of durability only when it hits an entity, and doesn't use much when it doesn't hit anything(-1 durability for example). Also, it needs mending to be compatible with lunge.

Absolutely, since lunging a movement rather than a use of the weapon that could cause damage (attacking, etc). Or at least lower it to 1 durability similar to Riptide. Or, better yet, make both Riptide and Lunging use hunger bars.

If it hits an enemy though, a bigger durability loss seems alright. Definitely not where it's at now though.

Yes! I actually thought of this but found this. It could bea cooldown but that would make it bad for parkour. I thouglt that one lunge could take one hunger from the player. We need this to gain popularity and thank you so much for posting.

That's a good idea! But I think it could be done like this: When you use Lunge, a little durability is removed from your spear, a little hunger is removed from you (0.5, for example), and if you lunge too many times (say, 3-4 times without stopping), you are inflicted with the "Fatigue" effect, and you can't run or lunge for about 4-10 seconds (this is just a placeholder; if they did this, they could specify as many seconds as the developers wanted).
I’m a happy man!! TY mojang!

Now it consumes too much hunger.

I like the idea that the player gets tired from using the lunge, like stamina.

But now you have to be eating constantly. Well, it can be solved with suspicious soups of saturation, but it's not profitable.

The ideal balanced point would be for it to now consume half the hunger it consumed before, and that other half of the penalty is returned to durability, and with Unbreaking III, it's likely it won't be spent.

But making the hunger penalty is something I like, just not so much.

Or simply add more cooldown so it's not overexploited by players.

Although keep in mind that Ender Pearls and Riptide already exist, the lunge isn't as broken as Mojang thinks; there are more powerful items.
I agree, it does.

Sea anemone

i had to look up spelling for that one
there are already texture packs and mods (like "Particular" with 6.5M of downloads) that does that, so, it's possible, it's cool, makes the world feel more alive and interactive.
Why not Plankton? Simple life form of the sea eaten by most sea creatures. Easy "Ambient" mob like you're mentioning.

given there are zombie villagers in those sometimes too, maybe zombie horse instead, keeping skeleton ones as rare "reward" from skeleton horse traps and keeping theme of them being zombies, maybe making skeleton one rarer in those
(disclaimer, no idea how rare zombie horsemen are supposed to be compared to skeleton horse traps)
The pig could also be made faster and able to cause damage to a mob upon impact. Stopping the pig however.
#JusticeForThePigs!

Why can't cats too than since we have dog armour
-ZIMIZOOM
pigs should have more use, not just armor
I mean if this is a mount update make it have armor for ALL THE MOUNTS!
Same deal here, all realms have same issue. Just had an update for them to announce some new event. But fix the game, apparently not. Just roll my stuff back. It is ridiculous.

I am upvoting every post that says this, and have made my own post on it as well. We all need to make as much noise on this as possible until Mojang changes this. We cannot have them thinking that we have accepted this as “normal.”
Slightly better on single player worlds than servers, but as someone who mainly plays on server, this new "intended" ""feature"" makes me very very sad
We need to keep upvoting every post like this and sharing it with other people to do the same until it makes it to the top of the feedback list
add the drowned as well on the areas that have water
Yes, horses for patrols, but, I think Pillager Spearmen on Ravagers would be more fitting for raids.

THIS!!! MOJANG I BEG! Right now, Sand, even though it is renewable, is non-automatable (requires opening Wandering Trader's Trading Menu). BUT sand is a really important primary resource, so it is used in lots of things. This causes a lot of players to build sand duppers, a non intended way of getting sand, and it's kinda... cheating? Dupping things doesn't sound too legit to me. Parched dropping sand would resolve this issue.

So, THIS!
Yes

I don't know about the Corruption bit, but I think a new "Skeleton Horseman" Event-type mob would be great. I'm thinking that a Zombie with full enchanted Iron Plate, enchanted Iron Spear, and Iron Horse Armour on, with, of course, a Shield and a Carved Punpkin head. What an utter menace that would be. Perhaps it could be a Pale Garden exclusive

This rare weather event should also happen in survival mode on hard difficulty, in case hardcore is too hard for this event. However, a new achievement called Resisting the Mist is obtained when you survive the entire night outside without dying throughout the night in default survival, hard difficulty. (Defying the Mist is still reserved for hardcore mode.)

I think "corruption" wouldnt work great for vanilla, description really reminds me thaumcraft (not bad thing necessarily, and yes, before it was added, sculk stuff also would feel same so ye..)
mist being poisonous also would be unnecessarily punishing unless there would be way to counter such thing, maybe darkness itself could hurt you during such weather, if outside, so placing light sources could prevent it, or seeking shelter/cave
netherite armor on mobs, especially ones found in overworld wouldnt likely happen, so far it is supposed to be most unobtainable armor in game, not even renewable by any means (other than exploits basically), I think diamond armor on them or just mob having beefed up stats would be challenging enough, only real benefit netherite here would have would be atmosphere, it being darker and all
having some sinister mist and unique undead horseman spawning could be cool, maybe skeleton could still have bows, basically being harder variant of skeleton riders we already got, and zombies being melee ones with spears
Maybe this event would be good for a halloween seasonal event, similar to how chests turn into presents at Xmas time.

I like this idea, but I think it should occur in all the game modes, not just hardcore (although it could be more common in hardcore than in other game modes). It should also be summonable with an item, so that a player who wants to see if they can survive the mist can choose to make it spawn if they find the item in a chest.

Hm. Personally I LOVE this but I'm not entirely sure this fits in the base game? However if it's localized to a biome (Pale Garden or Deep Dark) or a specific mechanic (Skulk Catalysts), then it fits the base game for every player. 

I propose a sub-biome like the Pale Garden but for the Plains. This is as you described but more localized. Killing the Headless Horseman expands the biome by 10-20 blocks in a random direction.

They should. But without loyalty. They should stay in the target and than fall off after the target dies.

It should be thrown by charging it by looking up a little bit.

Take away the only identity and use that Tridents have, sure great idea.

You're also suggesting that they make the Spears look like Tridents because it needs a 3D worldmodel, I'm sure you can see how much of a down grade that'd be

The problem is that what mojang presented as a "Spear" is actually a Lance... Yeah doesn't make much sense, like the "Flint and Steel" being made with Iron instead of Steel. Whatever, I hope they change the name of the Spear to Lance.
Listen: Why not to make that as enhancement? Like 'throwing'.
They should be thrown instead of hold for the charge attack while not on mount. Charge should only works on mount so it makes sense.

Personally I'd like to see them enchantable with loyalty. It would replace the charge mechanic with throwing. That way people who want throwing can have it, but it with interfere with the regular spear. (and gives loyalty another weapon it can enchant)

I actually very much agree with this. In fact, I was cofused at first because I thought they already added this. Make it throwable but really short range. Make it a lay man’s weapon. Because then it doesn’t really take away from the tridents identity, the spear is short range and has all its quirks,

I kinda fear that making it throwable would make it clash with the Trident. One of the things that makes the Trident unique is its ability to be both thrown and used as a melee weapon, just like the spear would be. I think they would need to differentiate how it would be thrown if they were to add this feature, like making it throw in an arch, for example.
Making it throwable would make the trident essentially obsolete, so renaming the spear to the more fitting lance would be a better choice

I think they should leave it as it is, tridents already exist as the throwing weapon, why add another one to do the exact same thing? We also shouldnt rename it to a lance because lances are completely different from spears. Just because you happen to be using it like you would a lance doesnt change what the item is... and spears are used off of mounts, which lances arent, so thats why its a spear and not a lance, because you use it on and off mounts.
Well, the name and actions contradicts itself. Mojang either needs to change the name or simply make it so that you can throw the spear
Sooo basically a trident, but better? And 20x easier to get? And craftable? And also used by like all mobs?
would be extremely suprised if this wasn't added in the next snapshot.
У меня даже есть небольшой концепт к примеру образу
I already suggested this in my post "Lying-on-the-stomach animation while Riding on nautilus". But I will vote here too
I think maybe just the wither horse would be pretty cool the other 2 I think are a bit much

I think that the Stray Horse is fine, however I think the Wither Horse needs to give the rider the Wither Effect. (I know, counter intuative) but the effect can be reduced if the mount is wearing armor. Being able to ride in the lava sea is a bit much though, given the Strider exists.

The Bogged Horse is also a bit much, there should be a trample mechanic that causes poison if a mob is trampled by the rider. Beyond that, being in the vicinity of said horse should not cause poison damage.

The Stray Horse is perfectly fine though.
Same thing for zombie nautilus!

Bro, I have a similar proposal, and I really hope that our proposals will be heard. It would be an incredible implementation, so much so that it would motivate us to explore all terrains in a good way with that prehistoric tank, the sniffer.
yesss it would be like war elephants

Llamas and donkeys already exist for transporting items via animal, why not use multiple llamas attatched to a donkey rather than the animal that is super slow? Sniffers dont look like they would be built for speed.

Multiple lamas attached to a donkey won't give me a TANK! If a sniffer has armor and can knock back hostiles similar to the knockback enchantment then the sniffer becomes a loved mob! It also fuels the 'Mounts of Mayhem' theme. More mayhem! Easily! 

Also, if donkeys, mules, and lamas have chests why shouldn't big animals like a sniffer or the camel also have chests. IRL camels are used to transport goods. Horses are used to transport goods. 

I made this suggestion because it fit the theme and I'd genuinely love to see it in game. Minecraft is cool because it gives us many ways to achieve an outcome. I want to add sniffers to transportation and combat mayhem. It fits, is Minecrafty, and has reasonable emergent game potential.

or simply be able to call only the last entity you mounted.

or be able to link a specific horn with a mount / entity with a specific mount, exactly like the magnetites.
Copper horns right-clicked on an animal summon the animal when you blow it. If that's too op, add a hearing range.
Espessialy cool if you have team colored leather armor like red, blue, green and would like your mount to have it too.
Probably
I guess... Your leather is going to be very soggy. Maybe stick to metal. Also, would the leather really be more protective than the shell it already has?

It doesn't have to be more protective, same can be said for leather horse armor. And metal would rust under water if we fo super realistically. What i want for it to be purely estetic, so you can choose the color of the shell more precisely than only blue for diamond and other metals.

Prehaps it could be charged up by air, bubble colomns, and conduits.

It could also reduce damage from aquatic mobs, and maybe maces.

Being charged up by air, bubble columns and conduits is a great idea (as the person above me stated). To add, maybe instead of 10 seconds the title breathing effect could be buffed to 20 or 30 seconds.

I love that

However i would rename them for something i think sounds cooler:

Frostbitten: snowy zombie

Rotten: swamp zombie

Sunken: ocean skeleton
Could be wood to balance it. You can't ride entities or run while crouching so that's cool.
I think that there should be a parry effect that inhibits movement if this act is performed. That would be quite nifty.

I would very much enjoy the ability to use a long pointy thing with the shield, it'd be very nice. Even if you need to crouch, I don't care. I need to be able to block instead of joust if I'm holding a shield.
Do you mean a sherd with a nautilus design on it? If so then sure why not.
Yeah that was strange seeing illagers be one shot by the spear.

Minecraft dungeons helped with that, giving the illagers armor and some illagers were enchanted, seriusly, mojang really need to recycle more content of preview games, that mechanics were so dope and could be amazing in vanilla minecraft
You should also be able to get a shoulder pad from illagers and also be able to craft one with three of any material in the corner of the crafting grid
Absolutely agree with this. It would also just be easier to tell if it's a siege and not just an unusual amount of zombies!
This could make them a little more dangerous. Prehaps the chances of them appearing depend on the difficulty?
